channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Storm Bert Batters UK With Rain and Fierce Winds, Killing at Least 3
item.description: Torrential rain doused most of the country, stymying travel and leading to widespread flooding, landslides, fallen trees and power outages.

item.title: Billionaires Bill Ackman, Marc Andreessen, and Travis Kalanick are reportedly getting involved in DOGE
item.description: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy are looking to Silicon Valley leaders for an unofficial government entity, according to the Washington Post.

item.title: An A.I. Granny Is Phone Scammers’ Worst Nightmare
item.description: Daisy Harris, an A.I.-generated English granny, has been stymying scammers with meandering, time-wasting conversations. But can she actually make a de...

item.title: Dangerous ultra-processed foods are linked to more than 30 health conditions. Here’s how to identify and avoid them
item.description: Processing isn't inherently negative—the extent of processing and its impact on nutrient density are critical factors to consider.

item.title: This CEO fired 90% of his staff for missing a morning meeting. He stands by the choice
item.description: ‘Firing those individuals was the right move for our organization, and we are stronger than ever,’ the CEO later wrote on LinkedIn.

item.title: UAE Arrests 3 in Connection With Murder of Israeli Rabbi
item.description: Israeli authorities say the abduction and killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan was an act of antisemitic terrorism, but investigators have not yet stated a moti...

item.title: Tether was an outlaw for years. Now the $132 billion stablecoin has a key ally in Trump’s Cabinet
item.description: The controversial Tether is reportedly facing a probe from both the Justice and Treasury departments.

item.title: Devoted Aide Who Keeps Good News Flowing Will Follow Trump to the White House
item.description: Natalie Harp, a 33-year-old former anchor on a right-wing cable show, is poised to become the primary conveyor belt for information to and from the pr...

item.title: Protesters Defy Pakistan Crackdown to Demand Imran Khan’s Release
item.description: Protesters march to Pakistan’s capital amid a city lockdown and violent clashes with the police as political tensions surge.

item.title: Hard-Right Candidate Wins First Round of Romania’s Presidential Election
item.description: Calin Georgescu, who had been widely dismissed as a fringe candidate, won the most votes on Sunday with 22.9 percent. He will face a more centrist opp...

item.title: Kennedy’s Antivax Views and Friends Can Cause Real Damage
item.description: What he did during a measles epidemic in Samoa shouldn’t be forgotten.

item.title: The ‘Rocket Docket’ Judge Who Will Decide the Fate of Google’s Ad Technology
item.description: The ruling by a federal judge, Leonie Brinkema, in an antitrust case over Google’s advertising technology could add to the internet company’s woes.

item.title: UAE Arrests 3 in Connection With Murder of Israeli Rabbi
item.description: Israeli authorities say the abduction and killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan was an act of antisemitic terrorism, but investigators have not yet stated a moti...

item.title: Hypertension is a ‘silent killer.’ Here’s what your blood pressure should be at every age
item.description: Over time, hypertension can lead to serious medical problems including stroke, heart attack, and kidney failure.

item.title: U.S. Says Google Is an Ad Tech Monopolist in Closing Arguments
item.description: The two sides made their final cases to a federal judge Monday in a trial over the tech giant’s dominance in technology selling ads online.
